definition: diction/enunciation/to pronounce the words correctly (in opera)
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: I learned to use a soft voice to oil my words.
sentences.chinese: 我已学会用柔音使自已的吐字圆润委婉。

sentences.english: Watching her struggle with her words and her memory, I couldn't believe it.
sentences.chinese: 看着她艰难吐字，拼命回忆，我简直难以置信。

sentences.english: Why dot 4 years old is saying a word still very unsharpness?
sentences.chinese: 为什么小孩子四岁了吐字还是很不清晰？

sentences.english: In popular music, for example, singers rarely take care to pronounce words clearly.
sentences.chinese: 例如在流行音乐中，歌手们从来不管是否吐字清楚。

definition: (of singing or speaking) very articulate pronunciation and vocalizing
mouth and teeth/enunciation/to articulate/diction/age (of cattle, horses etc)
pitch of voice (high or low)/pitch (of a musical note)/tone
see 頓挫抑揚|顿挫抑扬[dun4 cuo4 yi4 yang2]
